title: 113_hr3693
content: The Flood Insurance Relief and Transparency Act of 2013 delays premium rate increases for properties affected by map revisions or updates. The Flood Insurance Relief and Transparency Act of 2013 delays flood insurance premium rate changes until March 1, 2015. The Administrator of FEMA must disclose all data affecting rate changes by October 1, 2014. SEC. 3. AFFORDABILITY STUDY FUNDING. Amends the Biggert-Waters Flood Insurance Reform Act of 2012 to specify funding sources. SEC. 4. MONTHLY INSTALLMENT PAYMENTS FOR PREMIUMS. Section 1308 of the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968 is amended to allow policyholders the option of paying flood insurance premiums on a monthly basis if certain conditions are met. The Flood Disaster Protection Act of 1973 allows policyholders to pay monthly premiums through electronic fund transfer or automatic withdrawals. In case of a covered loss, the remaining premium for that term will be deducted from the claim payment. Policyholders must understand the payment terms and consequences for nonpayment. The Flood Disaster Protection Act of 1973 allows policyholders to pay monthly flood insurance premiums. The policyholder must pay \1/12\ of the total annual premium at the time of application or renewal, followed by equal monthly payments for the remaining 11 months. An administrative fee covers operating expenses, and failure to make a payment may result in consequences. The Administrator must provide a payment schedule for flood insurance policies, with payments collected through electronic fund transfer or automatic withdrawals. Failure to make a payment will result in immediate termination of coverage and ineligibility for monthly premium payments for a specified period. The Administrator may issue an endorsement to flood insurance policies allowing monthly payments, coverage cancellation for non-payment, and necessary terms within a 1-year period from enactment.
